trans-unit.source: Develop Java MapReduce programs for Hadoop | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Develop Java MapReduce programs for Hadoop | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to develop Java MapReduce programs on HDInsight emulator, how to deploy them to HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to develop Java MapReduce programs on HDInsight emulator, how to deploy them to HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: Develop Java MapReduce programs for Hadoop in HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Develop Java MapReduce programs for Hadoop in HDInsight

trans-unit.source: This tutorial walks you through an end-to-end scenario for developing a word-counting Hadoop MapReduce job in Java by using Apache Maven.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial walks you through an end-to-end scenario for developing a word-counting Hadoop MapReduce job in Java by using Apache Maven.

trans-unit.source: The tutorial also shows how to test the application on the HDInsight Emulator for Azure and then deploy and run it on an Windows-based HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: The tutorial also shows how to test the application on the HDInsight Emulator for Azure and then deploy and run it on an Windows-based HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Before you begin this tutorial, you must have completed the following:
trans-unit.target: Before you begin this tutorial, you must have completed the following:

trans-unit.source: Install the HDInsight Emulator.
trans-unit.target: Install the HDInsight Emulator.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see [Get started using HDInsight Emulator][hdinsight-emulator].
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see [Get started using HDInsight Emulator][hdinsight-emulator].

trans-unit.source: Make sure all the required services are running.
trans-unit.target: Make sure all the required services are running.

trans-unit.source: On the computer that has HDInsight Emulator installed, launch the Hadoop Command line from the Desktop shortcut, navigate to **C:\hdp**, and run the command **start_local_hdp_services.cmd**.
trans-unit.target: On the computer that has HDInsight Emulator installed, launch the Hadoop Command line from the Desktop shortcut, navigate to **C:\hdp**, and run the command **start_local_hdp_services.cmd**.

trans-unit.source: Install Azure PowerShell on the emulator computer.
trans-unit.target: Install Azure PowerShell on the emulator computer.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see [Install and configure Azure PowerShell][powershell-install-configure].
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see [Install and configure Azure PowerShell][powershell-install-configure].

trans-unit.source: Install Java platform JDK 7 or higher on the emulator computer.
trans-unit.target: Install Java platform JDK 7 or higher on the emulator computer.

trans-unit.source: This is already available on the emulator computer.
trans-unit.target: This is already available on the emulator computer.

trans-unit.source: Install and configure [Apache Maven](http://maven.apache.org/).
trans-unit.target: Install and configure [Apache Maven](http://maven.apache.org/).

trans-unit.source: Obtain an Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: Obtain an Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see [Purchase Options][azure-purchase-options], [Member Offers][azure-member-offers], or [Free Trial][azure-free-trial].
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see [Purchase Options][azure-purchase-options], [Member Offers][azure-member-offers], or [Free Trial][azure-free-trial].

trans-unit.source: Use Apache Maven to create a MapReduce program in Java
trans-unit.target: Use Apache Maven to create a MapReduce program in Java

trans-unit.source: Create a word-counting MapReduce application.
trans-unit.target: Create a word-counting MapReduce application.

trans-unit.source: It is a simple application that counts the occurrences of each word in a given input set.
trans-unit.target: It is a simple application that counts the occurrences of each word in a given input set.

trans-unit.source: In this section, we will performing the following tasks:
trans-unit.target: In this section, we will performing the following tasks:

trans-unit.source: Create a project by using Apache Maven
trans-unit.target: Create a project by using Apache Maven

trans-unit.source: Update the Project Object Model (POM)
trans-unit.target: Update the Project Object Model (POM)

trans-unit.source: Create the word-counting MapReduce application
trans-unit.target: Create the word-counting MapReduce application

trans-unit.source: Build and package the application
trans-unit.target: Build and package the application

trans-unit.source: **To create a project by using Maven**
trans-unit.target: **To create a project by using Maven**

trans-unit.source: Create a directory **C:\Tutorials\WordCountJava\**.
trans-unit.target: Create a directory **C:\Tutorials\WordCountJava\**.

trans-unit.source: From the command line in your development environment, change directories to the location you created.
trans-unit.target: From the command line in your development environment, change directories to the location you created.

trans-unit.source: Use the __mvn__ command, which is installed with Maven, to generate the scaffolding for the project.
trans-unit.target: Use the __mvn__ command, which is installed with Maven, to generate the scaffolding for the project.

trans-unit.source: This will create a new directory in the current directory, with the name specified by the __artifactID__ parameter (**wordcountjava** in this example.) This directory will contain the following items:
trans-unit.target: This will create a new directory in the current directory, with the name specified by the __artifactID__ parameter (**wordcountjava** in this example.) This directory will contain the following items:

trans-unit.source: __pom.xml__ - The [Project Object Model (POM)](http://maven.apache.org/guides/introduction/introduction-to-the-pom.html) that contains information and configuration details used to build the project.
trans-unit.target: __pom.xml__ - The [Project Object Model (POM)](http://maven.apache.org/guides/introduction/introduction-to-the-pom.html) that contains information and configuration details used to build the project.

trans-unit.source: __src__ - The directory that contains the __main\java\org\apache\hadoop\examples__ directory, where you will author the application.
trans-unit.target: __src__ - The directory that contains the __main\java\org\apache\hadoop\examples__ directory, where you will author the application.

trans-unit.source: Delete the __src\test\java\org\apache\hadoop\examples\apptest.java__ file, as it will not be used in this example.
trans-unit.target: Delete the __src\test\java\org\apache\hadoop\examples\apptest.java__ file, as it will not be used in this example.

trans-unit.source: **To update the POM**
trans-unit.target: **To update the POM**

trans-unit.source: Edit the __pom.xml__ file and add the following inside the `<dependencies>` section:
trans-unit.target: Edit the __pom.xml__ file and add the following inside the `<dependencies>` section:

trans-unit.source: This tells Maven that the project requires the libraries (listed within <artifactId\>) with a specific version (listed within <version\>).
trans-unit.target: This tells Maven that the project requires the libraries (listed within <artifactId\>) with a specific version (listed within <version\>).

trans-unit.source: At compile time, this will be downloaded from the default Maven repository.
trans-unit.target: At compile time, this will be downloaded from the default Maven repository.

trans-unit.source: You can use the [Maven repository search](http://search.maven.org/#artifactdetails%7Corg.apache.hadoop%7Chadoop-mapreduce-examples%7C2.5.1%7Cjar) to view more.
trans-unit.target: You can use the [Maven repository search](http://search.maven.org/#artifactdetails%7Corg.apache.hadoop%7Chadoop-mapreduce-examples%7C2.5.1%7Cjar) to view more.

trans-unit.source: Add the following to the __pom.xml__ file.
trans-unit.target: Add the following to the __pom.xml__ file.

trans-unit.source: This must be inside the `<project>...</project>` tags in the file; for example, between `</dependencies>` and `</project>`.
trans-unit.target: This must be inside the `<project>...</project>` tags in the file; for example, between `</dependencies>` and `</project>`.

trans-unit.source: This configures the [Maven Shade Plugin](http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-shade-plugin/), which is used to prevent license duplication in the JAR file that is built by Maven.
trans-unit.target: This configures the [Maven Shade Plugin](http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-shade-plugin/), which is used to prevent license duplication in the JAR file that is built by Maven.

trans-unit.source: The reason this is used is that the duplicate license files cause an error at run time on the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: The reason this is used is that the duplicate license files cause an error at run time on the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: Using the Maven Shade Plugin with the `ApacheLicenseResourceTransformer` implementation prevents this error.
trans-unit.target: Using the Maven Shade Plugin with the `ApacheLicenseResourceTransformer` implementation prevents this error.

trans-unit.source: The Maven Shade Plugin will also produce an uberjar (sometimes called a fatjar), which contains all the dependencies required by the application.
trans-unit.target: The Maven Shade Plugin will also produce an uberjar (sometimes called a fatjar), which contains all the dependencies required by the application.

trans-unit.source: Save the __pom.xml__ file.
trans-unit.target: Save the __pom.xml__ file.

trans-unit.source: **To create the word-counting application**
trans-unit.target: **To create the word-counting application**

trans-unit.source: Go to the __wordcountjava\src\main\java\org\apache\hadoop\examples__ directory and rename the __app.java__ file to __WordCount.java__.
trans-unit.target: Go to the __wordcountjava\src\main\java\org\apache\hadoop\examples__ directory and rename the __app.java__ file to __WordCount.java__.

trans-unit.source: Open Notepad.
trans-unit.target: Open Notepad.

trans-unit.source: Copy and paste the following program into Notepad:
trans-unit.target: Copy and paste the following program into Notepad:

trans-unit.source: Notice the package name is **org.apache.hadoop.examples** and the class name is **WordCount**.
trans-unit.target: Notice the package name is **org.apache.hadoop.examples** and the class name is **WordCount**.

trans-unit.source: You will use these names when you submit the MapReduce job.
trans-unit.target: You will use these names when you submit the MapReduce job.

trans-unit.source: Save the file.
trans-unit.target: Save the file.

trans-unit.source: **To build and package the application**
trans-unit.target: **To build and package the application**

trans-unit.source: Open a command prompt and change directories to the __wordcountjava__ directory.
trans-unit.target: Open a command prompt and change directories to the __wordcountjava__ directory.

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to build a JAR file containing the application:
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to build a JAR file containing the application:

trans-unit.source: This will clean any previous build artifacts, download any dependencies that have not already been installed, and then build and package the application.
trans-unit.target: This will clean any previous build artifacts, download any dependencies that have not already been installed, and then build and package the application.

trans-unit.source: Once the command finishes, the __wordcountjava\target__ directory will contain a file named __wordcountjava-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar__.
trans-unit.target: Once the command finishes, the __wordcountjava\target__ directory will contain a file named __wordcountjava-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar__.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The __wordcountjava-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar__ file is an uberjar.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The __wordcountjava-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar__ file is an uberjar.

trans-unit.source: Test the program on the emulator
trans-unit.target: Test the program on the emulator

trans-unit.source: Testing the MapReduce job on the HDInsight Emulator includes the following procedures:
trans-unit.target: Testing the MapReduce job on the HDInsight Emulator includes the following procedures:

trans-unit.source: Upload the data files to the Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS) on the emulator
trans-unit.target: Upload the data files to the Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS) on the emulator

trans-unit.source: Create a local user group
trans-unit.target: Create a local user group

trans-unit.source: Run a word-counting MapReduce job
trans-unit.target: Run a word-counting MapReduce job

trans-unit.source: Retrieve the job results
trans-unit.target: Retrieve the job results

trans-unit.source: By default, the HDInsight Emulator uses HDFS as the file system.
trans-unit.target: By default, the HDInsight Emulator uses HDFS as the file system.

trans-unit.source: Optionally, you can configure the HDInsight Emulator to use Azure Blob storage.
trans-unit.target: Optionally, you can configure the HDInsight Emulator to use Azure Blob storage.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Get started with HDInsight Emulator][hdinsight-emulator-wasb].
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Get started with HDInsight Emulator][hdinsight-emulator-wasb].

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you will use the HDFS **copyFromLocal** command to upload the data files to HDFS.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you will use the HDFS **copyFromLocal** command to upload the data files to HDFS.

trans-unit.source: The next section shows you how to upload files to Azure Blob storage by using Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: The next section shows you how to upload files to Azure Blob storage by using Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: For other methods for uploading files to Azure Blob storage, see [Upload data to HDInsight][hdinsight-upload-data].
trans-unit.target: For other methods for uploading files to Azure Blob storage, see [Upload data to HDInsight][hdinsight-upload-data].

trans-unit.source: This tutorial uses the following HDFS folder structure:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial uses the following HDFS folder structure:

trans-unit.source: Folder
trans-unit.target: Folder

trans-unit.source: Note
trans-unit.target: Note

trans-unit.source: /WordCount
trans-unit.target: /WordCount

trans-unit.source: The root folder for the word-counting project.
trans-unit.target: The root folder for the word-counting project.

trans-unit.source: /WordCount/Apps
trans-unit.target: /WordCount/Apps

trans-unit.source: The folder for the mapper and reducer executables.
trans-unit.target: The folder for the mapper and reducer executables.

trans-unit.source: /WordCount/Input
trans-unit.target: /WordCount/Input

trans-unit.source: The MapReduce source file folder.
trans-unit.target: The MapReduce source file folder.

trans-unit.source: /WordCount/Output
trans-unit.target: /WordCount/Output

trans-unit.source: The MapReduce output file folder.
trans-unit.target: The MapReduce output file folder.

trans-unit.source: /WordCount/MRStatusOutput
trans-unit.target: /WordCount/MRStatusOutput

trans-unit.source: The job output folder.
trans-unit.target: The job output folder.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial uses the .txt files located in the %hadoop_home% directory as the data files.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial uses the .txt files located in the %hadoop_home% directory as the data files.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The Hadoop HDFS commands are case sensitive.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The Hadoop HDFS commands are case sensitive.

trans-unit.source: **To copy the data files to the emulator HDFS**
trans-unit.target: **To copy the data files to the emulator HDFS**

trans-unit.source: Open the Hadoop command line from your desktop.
trans-unit.target: Open the Hadoop command line from your desktop.

trans-unit.source: The Hadoop command line is installed by the emulator installer.
trans-unit.target: The Hadoop command line is installed by the emulator installer.

trans-unit.source: From the Hadoop command-line window, run the following command to make a directory for the input files:
trans-unit.target: From the Hadoop command-line window, run the following command to make a directory for the input files:

trans-unit.target: The path used here is the relative path.

trans-unit.source: It is equivalent to the following:
trans-unit.target: It is equivalent to the following:

trans-unit.target: Run the following command to copy some text files to the input folder on HDFS:

trans-unit.source: The MapReduce job will count the words in these files.
trans-unit.target: The MapReduce job will count the words in these files.

trans-unit.source: Run the following command to list and verify the uploaded files:
trans-unit.target: Run the following command to list and verify the uploaded files:

trans-unit.source: **To create a local user group**
trans-unit.target: **To create a local user group**

trans-unit.source: To successfully run the MapReduce job on the cluster, you must create a user group called hdfs.
trans-unit.target: To successfully run the MapReduce job on the cluster, you must create a user group called hdfs.

trans-unit.source: To this group, you must also add a user called hadoop and the local user with which you log on to the emulator.
trans-unit.target: To this group, you must also add a user called hadoop and the local user with which you log on to the emulator.

trans-unit.source: Use the following commands from an elevated command prompt:
trans-unit.target: Use the following commands from an elevated command prompt:

trans-unit.source: **To run the MapReduce job by using the Hadoop command line**
trans-unit.target: **To run the MapReduce job by using the Hadoop command line**

trans-unit.source: Open the Hadoop command line from your desktop.
trans-unit.target: Open the Hadoop command line from your desktop.

trans-unit.source: Run the following command to delete the /WordCount/Output folder structure from HDFS.
trans-unit.target: Run the following command to delete the /WordCount/Output folder structure from HDFS.

trans-unit.source: /WordCount/Output is the output folder of the word-counting MapReduce job.
trans-unit.target: /WordCount/Output is the output folder of the word-counting MapReduce job.

trans-unit.source: The MapReduce job will fail if the folder already exists.
trans-unit.target: The MapReduce job will fail if the folder already exists.

trans-unit.source: This step is necessary if this is the second time you're running the job.
trans-unit.target: This step is necessary if this is the second time you're running the job.

trans-unit.source: Run the following command:
trans-unit.target: Run the following command:

trans-unit.source: If the job finishes successfully, you should get an output similar to the following screenshot:
trans-unit.target: If the job finishes successfully, you should get an output similar to the following screenshot:

trans-unit.source: ![HDI.EMulator.WordCount.Run][image-emulator-wordcount-run]
trans-unit.target: ![HDI.EMulator.WordCount.Run][image-emulator-wordcount-run]

trans-unit.source: From the screenshot, you can see both map and reduce finished 100%.
trans-unit.target: From the screenshot, you can see both map and reduce finished 100%.

trans-unit.source: It also lists the job ID.
trans-unit.target: It also lists the job ID.

trans-unit.source: The same report can be retrieved by opening the **Hadoop MapReduce status** shortcut from your desktop, and looking for the same job ID.
trans-unit.target: The same report can be retrieved by opening the **Hadoop MapReduce status** shortcut from your desktop, and looking for the same job ID.

trans-unit.source: The other option for running a MapReduce job is using Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: The other option for running a MapReduce job is using Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see [Get started with the HDInsight Emulator][hdinsight-emulator].
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see [Get started with the HDInsight Emulator][hdinsight-emulator].

trans-unit.source: **To display the output from HDFS**
trans-unit.target: **To display the output from HDFS**

trans-unit.source: Open the Hadoop command line.
trans-unit.target: Open the Hadoop command line.

trans-unit.source: Run the following commands to display the output:
trans-unit.target: Run the following commands to display the output:

trans-unit.source: You can append "|more" at the end of the command to get the page view.
trans-unit.target: You can append "|more" at the end of the command to get the page view.

trans-unit.source: Or use the **findstr** command to find a string pattern:
trans-unit.target: Or use the **findstr** command to find a string pattern:

trans-unit.source: You have now developed a word-counting MapReduce job and tested it successfully on the emulator.
trans-unit.target: You have now developed a word-counting MapReduce job and tested it successfully on the emulator.

trans-unit.source: The next step is to deploy and run it on Azure HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: The next step is to deploy and run it on Azure HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: Upload data and application to Azure Blob storage
trans-unit.target: Upload data and application to Azure Blob storage

trans-unit.source: Azure HDInsight uses Azure Blob storage for data storage.
trans-unit.target: Azure HDInsight uses Azure Blob storage for data storage.

trans-unit.source: When an HDInsight cluster is provisioned, an Azure Blob storage container is used to store the system files.
trans-unit.target: When an HDInsight cluster is provisioned, an Azure Blob storage container is used to store the system files.

trans-unit.source: You can use either this default container or a different container (either on the same Azure Storage account or on a different Storage account located in the same region as the cluster) for storing the data files.
trans-unit.target: You can use either this default container or a different container (either on the same Azure Storage account or on a different Storage account located in the same region as the cluster) for storing the data files.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you will create a container on a separate Storage account for the data files and the MapReduce application.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you will create a container on a separate Storage account for the data files and the MapReduce application.

trans-unit.source: The data files are the text files in the **C:\hdp\hadoop-2.4.0.2.1.3.0-1981\share\doc\hadoop\common** directory on your emulator workstation.
trans-unit.target: The data files are the text files in the **C:\hdp\hadoop-2.4.0.2.1.3.0-1981\share\doc\hadoop\common** directory on your emulator workstation.

trans-unit.source: **To create a Blob storage account and a container**
trans-unit.target: **To create a Blob storage account and a container**

trans-unit.source: Open Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: Open Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: Set the variables, and then run the commands:
trans-unit.target: Set the variables, and then run the commands:

trans-unit.source: The **$subscripionName** variable is associated with your Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: The **$subscripionName** variable is associated with your Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: You must name **$storageAccountName\_Data** and **$containerName\_Data**.
trans-unit.target: You must name **$storageAccountName\_Data** and **$containerName\_Data**.

trans-unit.source: For the naming restrictions, see [Naming and Referencing Containers, Blobs, and Metadata](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/dd135715.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For the naming restrictions, see [Naming and Referencing Containers, Blobs, and Metadata](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/dd135715.aspx).

trans-unit.target: Run the following commands to verify the Storage account and the container:

trans-unit.source: Run the MapReduce job on Azure HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Run the MapReduce job on Azure HDInsight

trans-unit.source: In this section, you will create an Azure PowerShell script that performs the following tasks:
trans-unit.target: In this section, you will create an Azure PowerShell script that performs the following tasks:

trans-unit.source: Provisions an HDInsight cluster
trans-unit.target: Provisions an HDInsight cluster

trans-unit.source: Create a Storage account that will be used as the default HDInsight cluster file system
trans-unit.target: Create a Storage account that will be used as the default HDInsight cluster file system

trans-unit.source: Create a Blob storage container
trans-unit.target: Create a Blob storage container

trans-unit.source: Create an HDInsight cluster
trans-unit.target: Create an HDInsight cluster

trans-unit.source: Submits the MapReduce job
trans-unit.target: Submits the MapReduce job

trans-unit.source: Create a MapReduce job definition
trans-unit.target: Create a MapReduce job definition

trans-unit.source: Submit a MapReduce job
trans-unit.target: Submit a MapReduce job

trans-unit.source: Wait for the job to finish
trans-unit.target: Wait for the job to finish

trans-unit.source: Display standard error
trans-unit.target: Display standard error

trans-unit.source: Display standard output
trans-unit.target: Display standard output

trans-unit.source: Deletes the cluster
trans-unit.target: Deletes the cluster

trans-unit.source: Delete the HDInsight cluster
trans-unit.target: Delete the HDInsight cluster

trans-unit.source: Delete the Storage account used as the default HDInsight cluster file system
trans-unit.target: Delete the Storage account used as the default HDInsight cluster file system

trans-unit.source: **To run the Azure PowerShell script**
trans-unit.target: **To run the Azure PowerShell script**

trans-unit.source: Open Notepad.
trans-unit.target: Open Notepad.

trans-unit.source: Copy and paste the following code:
trans-unit.target: Copy and paste the following code:

trans-unit.source: Set the first six variables in the script.
trans-unit.target: Set the first six variables in the script.

trans-unit.source: The **$stringPrefix** variable is used to prefix the specified string to the HDInsight cluster name, the Storage account name, and the Blob storage container name.
trans-unit.target: The **$stringPrefix** variable is used to prefix the specified string to the HDInsight cluster name, the Storage account name, and the Blob storage container name.

trans-unit.source: Because the names for these must be 3 to 24 characters, make sure the string you specify and the names this script uses, together, do not exceed the character limit for the name.
trans-unit.target: Because the names for these must be 3 to 24 characters, make sure the string you specify and the names this script uses, together, do not exceed the character limit for the name.

trans-unit.source: You must use all lowercase for **$stringPrefix**.
trans-unit.target: You must use all lowercase for **$stringPrefix**.

trans-unit.source: The **$storageAccountName\_Data** and **$containerName\_Data** variables are the Storage account and container that are used for storing the data files and the application.
trans-unit.target: The **$storageAccountName\_Data** and **$containerName\_Data** variables are the Storage account and container that are used for storing the data files and the application.

trans-unit.source: The **$location** variable must match the data Storage account location.
trans-unit.target: The **$location** variable must match the data Storage account location.

trans-unit.source: Review the rest of the variables.
trans-unit.target: Review the rest of the variables.

trans-unit.source: Save the script file.
trans-unit.target: Save the script file.

trans-unit.source: Open Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: Open Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: Run the following command to set the execution policy to RemoteSigned:
trans-unit.target: Run the following command to set the execution policy to RemoteSigned:

trans-unit.source: When prompted, enter the user name and password for the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: When prompted, enter the user name and password for the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: Because you will delete the cluster at the end of the script and you will not need the user name and password anymore, the user name and password can be any strings.
trans-unit.target: Because you will delete the cluster at the end of the script and you will not need the user name and password anymore, the user name and password can be any strings.

trans-unit.source: If you don't want to get prompted for the credentials, see [Working with Passwords, Secure Strings and Credentials in Windows PowerShell][powershell-PSCredential].
trans-unit.target: If you don't want to get prompted for the credentials, see [Working with Passwords, Secure Strings and Credentials in Windows PowerShell][powershell-PSCredential].

trans-unit.source: Retrieve the MapReduce job output This section shows you how to download and display the output.
trans-unit.target: Retrieve the MapReduce job output This section shows you how to download and display the output.

trans-unit.source: For the information on displaying the results in Excel, see [Connect Excel to HDInsight with the Microsoft Hive ODBC Driver][hdinsight-ODBC] and [Connect Excel to HDInsight with Power Query][hdinsight-power-query].
trans-unit.target: For the information on displaying the results in Excel, see [Connect Excel to HDInsight with the Microsoft Hive ODBC Driver][hdinsight-ODBC] and [Connect Excel to HDInsight with Power Query][hdinsight-power-query].

trans-unit.source: **To retrieve the output**
trans-unit.target: **To retrieve the output**

trans-unit.source: Open the Azure PowerShell window.
trans-unit.target: Open the Azure PowerShell window.

trans-unit.source: Change the directory to **C:\Tutorials\WordCountJava**.
trans-unit.target: Change the directory to **C:\Tutorials\WordCountJava**.

trans-unit.source: The default Azure PowerShell folder is **C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0**.
trans-unit.target: The default Azure PowerShell folder is **C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0**.

trans-unit.source: The cmdlets you will run will download the output file to the current folder.
trans-unit.target: The cmdlets you will run will download the output file to the current folder.

trans-unit.source: You don't have permissions to download the files to the system folders.
trans-unit.target: You don't have permissions to download the files to the system folders.

trans-unit.source: Run the following commands to set the values:
trans-unit.target: Run the following commands to set the values:

trans-unit.source: Run the following commands to create an Azure storage context object:
trans-unit.target: Run the following commands to create an Azure storage context object:

trans-unit.source: Run the following commands to download and display the output:
trans-unit.target: Run the following commands to download and display the output:

trans-unit.source: After the job is completed, you have the option to export the data to SQL Server or Azure SQL Database by using [Sqoop][hdinsight-use-sqoop], or to export the data to Excel.
trans-unit.target: After the job is completed, you have the option to export the data to SQL Server or Azure SQL Database by using [Sqoop][hdinsight-use-sqoop], or to export the data to Excel.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you have learned how to develop a Java MapReduce job, how to test the application on the HDInsight Emulator, and how to write an Azure PowerShell script to provision an HDInsight cluster and run a MapReduce job on the cluster.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you have learned how to develop a Java MapReduce job, how to test the application on the HDInsight Emulator, and how to write an Azure PowerShell script to provision an HDInsight cluster and run a MapReduce job on the cluster.
